body_html:
Multiple python versions was something we have not considered, I will take that into account when moving forward. In our dockerfiles, we certainly want to default to latest python versions moving forward.
However, I think we can parameterize python versions on the dockerfiles so it is possible to run our CI in them.
Having the community maintain these dockerfiles is also another viable option.
body_text:
Multiple python versions was something we have not considered, I will take that into account when moving forward. In our dockerfiles, we certainly want to default to latest python versions moving forward.
However, I think we can parameterize python versions on the dockerfiles so it is possible to run our CI in them.
Having the community maintain these dockerfiles is also another viable option.
body:
Multiple python versions was something we have not considered, I will take that into account when moving forward. In our dockerfiles, we certainly want to default to latest python versions moving forward.
However, I think we can parameterize python versions on the dockerfiles so it is possible to run our CI in them.
Having the community maintain these dockerfiles is also another viable option.
